trec-20221.raw: A 19-year-old male came to clinic with some sexual concern.  He recently engaged in a relationship and is worried about the satisfaction of his girlfriend. He has a "baby face" according to his girlfriend's statement and he is not as muscular as his classmates.  On physical examination, there is some pubic hair and poorly developed secondary sexual characteristics. He is unable to detect coffee smell during the examination, but the visual acuity is normal. Ultrasound reveals the testes volume of 1-2 ml. The hormonal evaluation showed serum testosterone level of 65 ng/dL with low levels of GnRH.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 19-year-old male with concerns about sexual satisfaction, underdeveloped secondary sexual characteristics, inability to detect coffee smell, small testes volume (1-2 ml), and hormonal evaluation showing low serum testosterone (65 ng/dL) and low levels of GnRH.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The main medical problems of the patient include sexual concerns, delayed puberty, and low testosterone levels.

trec-20222.raw: A 32-year-old woman comes to the hospital with vaginal spotting.  Her last menstrual period was 10 weeks ago. She has regular menses lasting for 6 days and repeating every 29 days. Medical history is significant for appendectomy and several complicated UTIs. She has multiple male partners, and she is inconsistent with using barrier contraceptives. Vital signs are normal.  Serum β-hCG level is 1800 mIU/mL, and a repeat level after 2 days shows an abnormal rise to 2100 mIU/mL.  Pelvic ultrasound reveals a thin endometrium with no gestational sac in the uterus.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 32-year-old woman presents with vaginal spotting, a last menstrual period 10 weeks ago, irregular rise in serum β-hCG levels, and a pelvic ultrasound showing a thin endometrium without a gestational sac in the uterus. Her medical history includes an appendectomy and several complicated UTIs. She has multiple male partners and is inconsistent with using barrier contraceptives.
conditions: History of complicated urinary tract infections (UTIs)

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 32-year-old woman presenting with vaginal spotting, irregular menstrual periods, a history of appendectomy and complicated UTIs, multiple male partners, and inconsistent use of barrier contraceptives. Serum β-hCG levels are abnormal and pelvic ultrasound shows a thin endometrium with no gestational sac in the uterus.
conditions: No gestational sac in the uterus

trec-20223.raw: A 51-year-old man comes to the office complaining of fatigue and some sexual problems including lack of libido. The patient doesn't smoke or use any illicit drug.  Blood pressure is 120/80 mm Hg and pulse is 70/min.  Oxygen saturation is 99% on room air.  BMI is 24 kg/m2.  Skin examination shows increased pigmentation. Genotype testing is consistent with homozygosity for the C282Y mutation. Laboratory study shows transferrin saturation of 55% and serum ferritin of 550 μg/L. He is diagnosed as a case of hemochromatosis.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 51-year-old man with fatigue, sexual problems including lack of libido, increased skin pigmentation, and diagnosed with hemochromatosis, indicated by homozygosity for the C282Y mutation, transferrin saturation of 55%, and serum ferritin of 550 µg/L.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 51-year-old man with fatigue and sexual problems, increased pigmentation, and a diagnosis of hemochromatosis.

trec-20224.raw: A 66-year-old woman comes to the office due to joint pain in the hands and periodic morning stiffness that lasts less than 15 minutes.  The pain is moderately severe and worsens with daily activity. The patient used Tylenol with minimal relief.  Past medical history is notable for hypertension and hypercholesteremia.  Physical examination shows firm nodules over the distal interphalangeal joints, bilaterally. The patient has pain in her knees as well. The knees are stiff in the morning for less than 30 minutes and become worse with climbing stairs. She has some sensation of bone friction during activity. X-ray shows narrowing of the joint space, subchondral bone sclerosis and osteophyte formation along the joints.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 66-year-old woman with joint pain in hands, morning stiffness lasting less than 15 minutes, firm nodules over the distal interphalangeal joints, knee pain and stiffness, sensation of bone friction during activity, and X-ray findings of joint space narrowing, subchondral bone sclerosis, and osteophyte formation. Past medical history includes hypertension and hypercholesteremia.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 66-year-old woman with joint pain in the hands and knees, morning stiffness, and evidence of joint damage on X-ray. She has a history of hypertension and hypercholesteremia.
conditions: Joint pain worsened by daily activity
Worsening knee pain with climbing stairs

trec-20225.raw: A 23-year-old man comes to the emergency department following an episode of syncope.  He was working out when he felt dizzy and passed out without head injury.  He has had 3 other episodes of light-headedness over the last year, all happening during physical activity. He never had this experience while resting. He has no other medical conditions.  The patient does not use tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drugs.  His father died suddenly at age 35.  Vital signs are within normal limits.  On physical examination, the patient has a harsh systolic murmur.  The lungs are clear with no peripheral edema. Echocardiography shows asymmetric interventricular septal hypertrophy.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 23-year-old man experienced syncope and light-headedness during physical activity, with a family history of sudden death at a young age. Examination revealed a harsh systolic murmur and echocardiography showed asymmetric interventricular septal hypertrophy.
conditions: Risk assessment in young adults with cardiac symptoms

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 23-year-old man who presented with syncope and a history of light-headedness during physical activity. He has a family history of sudden death and a harsh systolic murmur on physical examination. Echocardiography revealed asymmetric interventricular septal hypertrophy.

trec-20226.raw: A 61-year-old man comes to the clinic due to nonproductive cough and progressive dyspnea.  The patient's medical conditions include hypertension, hypercholesteremia and peptic ulcer disease.  He smokes 2 packs of cigarettes daily for the past 30 years.  On examination, there are decreased breath sounds and percussive dullness at the base of the left lung.  Other vital signs are normal. Abdomen is soft without tenderness. CT scan shows a left-sided pleural effusion and nodular thickening of the pleura. The plural fluid was bloody on thoracentesis. Biopsy shows proliferation of epithelioid-type cells with very long microvilli.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 61-year-old man with a history of hypertension, hypercholesteremia, and peptic ulcer disease, who is a heavy smoker, presents with nonproductive cough, progressive dyspnea, decreased breath sounds, and percussive dullness at the base of the left lung. CT scan reveals a left-sided pleural effusion and nodular thickening of the pleura, with bloody pleural fluid and biopsy showing proliferation of epithelioid-type cells with very long microvilli.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 61-year-old man with a nonproductive cough, progressive dyspnea, hypertension, hypercholesteremia, and peptic ulcer disease. He is a heavy smoker and has decreased breath sounds and percussive dullness at the base of the left lung. CT scan shows a left-sided pleural effusion and nodular thickening of the pleura. The pleural fluid was bloody on thoracentesis, and biopsy shows proliferation of epithelioid-type cells with very long microvilli.

trec-20227.raw: A 3-year-old girl is brought to the clinic by her parents for assessment of her short stature. Physical examination reveals short limbs and a relatively large head. She has a flat nasal bridge and a small midface. The girl's father exhibits similar physical features; however, her mother looks normal. The genetic testing reveals an autosomal dominant point mutation in the fibroblast growth factor receptor 3 (FGFR3) gene consistent with achondroplasia in both father and the child. The girl has not received any treatment yet, and it is her first visit after immigration to the US. The other mental and developmental examinations are unremarkable.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 3-year-old girl with a diagnosis of achondroplasia, indicated by short stature, short limbs, a relatively large head, flat nasal bridge, and a small midface. Genetic testing confirmed an autosomal dominant point mutation in the FGFR3 gene, a condition shared with her father. No treatments have been initiated.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 3-year-old girl with short stature, short limbs, a relatively large head, a flat nasal bridge, and a small midface. Genetic testing reveals an autosomal dominant point mutation in the FGFR3 gene consistent with achondroplasia. The patient has not received any treatment yet and is a recent immigrant to the US. Mental and developmental examinations are unremarkable.

trec-20228.raw: A 7-month-old boy is brought to emergency by his parents due to irritability and inability to defecate for the past 3 days.  The patient has had constipation and discomfort with bowel movements since birth.  His symptoms worsened after eating semi-solid foods.  Vital signs are normal.  Abdominal examination shows distension and tenderness to palpation with presence of bowel sounds.  Xray with barium shows a narrow rectum and rectosigmoid area.  The rest of the colon proximal to this segment is dilated. Digital rectal exam revealed burst of feces out of the anus. The biopsy showed absence of submucosal ganglia in the last segment of the large intestine.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 7-month-old boy presents with irritability, inability to defecate for 3 days, constipation, and discomfort with bowel movements since birth. Symptoms worsened with semi-solid foods. Examination shows abdominal distension, tenderness, and a narrow rectum and rectosigmoid area with dilation of the proximal colon. A biopsy indicates absence of submucosal ganglia in the last segment of the large intestine.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The main medical problems of the patient include chronic constipation, discomfort with bowel movements, distension and tenderness in the abdomen, and absence of submucosal ganglia in the last segment of the large intestine.
conditions: Worsening symptoms after eating semi-solid foods
Pediatric worsening symptoms after eating semi-solid foods

trec-20229.raw: A 67-year-old woman comes to the clinic due to recent episode of choking, dysphagia, and cough.  Her other medical problems include hypertension, dyslipidemia, and osteoarthritis.  She does not smoke or use alcohol. She lives with her husband and she is able to do her own daily activities. She used to teach elementary school. Blood pressure is 135/80 mm Hg.  The patient's breath smells bad. Other physical examinations are normal.  A barium swallow study reveals an abnormality in the upper esophagus with an outpouching at the junction of the lower part of the throat and the upper portion of the esophagus.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 67-year-old woman with a recent episode of choking, dysphagia, and cough, also suffering from hypertension, dyslipidemia, and osteoarthritis. A barium swallow study revealed an abnormality in the upper esophagus with an outpouching at the junction of the lower part of the throat and the upper portion of the esophagus.

trec-202210.raw: A 19-year-old girl comes to the clinic due to a left wrist mass.  She noticed swelling on the top of her wrist about 4 months ago and came to the clinic due to cosmetic concerns.  Examination shows a nontender, rounded mass on the dorsal wrist that transilluminates with a penlight. Vital signs are normal. The patient needs to type on her computer almost all day. She is left-handed. She does not smoke or use illicit drugs. She is in sexual relationship with two male partners and uses condoms.

She has a high daily computer usage due to typing, is left-handed, does not smoke or use illicit drugs, and is sexually active with two male partners, using condoms for protection.

trec-202211.raw: A 63-year-old man comes to the clinic for recent unintentional weight loss. The patient also has epigastric discomfort after meals. He has no known medical problems and takes no medications. His blood pressure is 130/75 and pulse rate is 88/min. He is not febrile. Upper endoscopy shows a lesion in the stomach that shows typical features of diffuse-type adenocarcinoma presenting with signet ring cells that do not form glands.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 63-year-old man presents with recent unintentional weight loss and epigastric discomfort after meals. An upper endoscopy revealed a lesion in the stomach with features of diffuse-type adenocarcinoma with signet ring cells.

trec-202212.raw: A 47-year-old man comes to the office for routine checkup. He is complaining of chronic cough and occasional but progressive dyspnea.  Other medical conditions include hypertension and osteoarthritis.  The patient smokes a pack of cigarettes daily and does not use alcohol or illicit drugs.  He used to be a construction worker. On examination, there are decreased breath sounds and percussive dullness at the base of both lungs.  Chest CT scan reveals a mild bilateral pleural effusion and diffuse thickening of the pleura. The patient's documents show chronic exposure to asbestosis. The specimen of the lungs reveled  pulmonary fibrosis that is most predominant in the lower lobes, characterized  by the presence of asbestos bodies (golden-brown beaded rods with translucent centers).

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 47-year-old male with a history of chronic cough, progressive dyspnea, hypertension, osteoarthritis, and a smoking habit. The patient has a work history as a construction worker and chronic exposure to asbestosis. Examination findings include decreased breath sounds, percussive dullness at the base of both lungs, mild bilateral pleural effusion, diffuse thickening of the pleura, and pulmonary fibrosis with asbestos bodies present in the lung specimen.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 47-year-old man with chronic cough, dyspnea, hypertension, osteoarthritis, and a history of chronic exposure to asbestosis. Examination findings include decreased breath sounds, percussive dullness at the base of both lungs, and imaging showing bilateral pleural effusion and diffuse pleural thickening. Lung specimen analysis reveals pulmonary fibrosis with asbestos bodies.

trec-202213.raw: A 24-year-old man comes to the office complaining of infertility.  He and his wife have been trying to conceive for the last 18 months.  Medical records of his wife showed no abnormalities.  The patient doesn't smoke and takes no medications.  Height is 185 cm and weight is 77 kg.  Heart and lung sounds are normal.  There is bilateral gynecomastia and bilateral descended firm testes.  The lower extremities appear abnormally long. His karyotype evaluation shows 47, XXY consistent with Klinefelter syndrome.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 24-year-old man with infertility, bilateral gynecomastia, and abnormally long lower extremities. Karyotype evaluation shows 47, XXY, consistent with Klinefelter syndrome.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 24-year-old man with infertility and clinical features consistent with Klinefelter syndrome.

trec-202214.raw: A 39-year-old man comes to the emergency department with an acute onset of severe left toe pain.  The toe is red and exhibits swelling. The patient is not febrile, and does not remember any recent trauma. Medical history is not significant except for the similar attacks and the diagnosis of gouty arthritis. His medication history includes Allopurinol to prevent gouty attacks. His father has the same medical condition. However, his older brother who is 41 years old is healthy with no history of gouty arthritis. Physical examination shows a swollen, tender first metatarsophalangeal joint.  Aspiration of the joint showed high leukocyte count, negative Gram stain, and numerous needle-shaped crystals, which is compatible with gouty arthritis.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 39-year-old man with a history of gouty arthritis presents with acute severe pain, redness, and swelling of the left toe, specifically the first metatarsophalangeal joint. Joint aspiration revealed high leukocyte count, negative Gram stain, and numerous needle-shaped crystals, confirming a gouty arthritis flare. His medication history includes Allopurinol for gout prevention, and there is a family history of gout.
conditions: Negative Gram stain in joint fluid

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 39-year-old man with a history of gouty arthritis presenting with acute onset of severe left toe pain, redness, and swelling. Physical examination and joint aspiration confirm the diagnosis of gouty arthritis.
conditions: High leukocyte count in joint aspiration
Positive family history of gouty arthritis

trec-202215.raw: An 8-year-old boy is brought to the clinic by his parents because of weakness and difficulty of standing up from a sitting position. The mother is healthy but had a brother who died in his 20th after being disabled and using wheelchairs in the last few years of his life. Physical examination shows 3/5 lower extremity muscle strength and enlarged calf muscles. The other physical examination and vital signs are unremarkable. Muscle biopsy showed absence of dystrophin protein. The patient is diagnosed with DMD.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: An 8-year-old boy diagnosed with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy (DMD), presenting with weakness, difficulty standing up from a sitting position, 3/5 lower extremity muscle strength, and enlarged calf muscles. Muscle biopsy confirmed the absence of dystrophin protein.
conditions: Respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is an 8-year-old boy with weakness and difficulty standing up from a sitting position. He has 3/5 lower extremity muscle strength and enlarged calf muscles. Muscle biopsy showed absence of dystrophin protein, leading to a diagnosis of Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD).

trec-202216.raw: A 39-year-old woman comes to the clinic complaining of arthralgias and nodules on her legs.  She has no fever or other skin rashes. The prior medical condition is unremarkable, and she takes no medications.  On physical examination, there is moderate hepatomegaly. The lesions on her legs are tender and present predominantly on the anterior surface of the lower extremities. She doesn't smoke and drinks alcohol occasionally. The patient has 2 male sexual partners. Vital signs are normal. Chest x-ray demonstrates enlarged hilar lymph nodes, and laboratory testing reveals an elevated ACE level. Biopsy of the skin lesion shows noncaseating granulomas that stain negative for fungi & acid-fast bacilli.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 39-year-old woman with arthralgias, skin nodules on legs, moderate hepatomegaly, enlarged hilar lymph nodes, elevated ACE level, and biopsy showing noncaseating granulomas negative for fungi & acid-fast bacilli.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 39-year-old woman presenting with arthralgias, nodules on her legs, hepatomegaly, and elevated ACE level. Biopsy of the skin lesion shows noncaseating granulomas.

trec-202217.raw: A 67-year-old man comes to the clinic with slowly worsening vision in both eyes.  He is not able to drive at night, as the symptoms are worse at night. His pupils are normal in diameter both in the light and darkness. Other medical history is unremarkable.  Ocular examination shows loss of the red reflex and blurry vision.  Acuity testing shows 50/100 vision in both eyes with normal visual field testing. His blood pressure is 130/70 and pulse is 68/min. the other physical examinations are normal.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 67-year-old man with slowly worsening vision in both eyes, worse at night, normal pupil diameter, loss of the red reflex, blurry vision, 50/100 vision acuity with normal visual field testing, and unremarkable other medical history.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 67-year-old man with slowly worsening vision in both eyes, particularly at night. Ocular examination reveals loss of the red reflex and blurry vision. Acuity testing shows 50/100 vision in both eyes with normal visual field testing.

trec-202218.raw: A 2-year-old boy is brought to the office by his parents due to a rash that started 1 week ago.  A similar red, itchy rash on the cheeks, trunk, and arms has occurred intermittently since infancy.  The patient has had a few upper respiratory infections but no major illnesses.  Vaccinations are up to date, and he takes no medications. He is on a balanced diet, and he is healthy in appearance.  Vital signs and milestone examination are within normal limits.  Similar findings are observed on the cheeks and proximal upper extremities.  The diaper area is clear, and no mucosal lesions are present.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 2-year-old boy with a history of intermittent red, itchy rashes on the cheeks, trunk, and arms since infancy, currently experiencing a similar rash. No major illnesses, up-to-date vaccinations, no medications, and a balanced diet. Vital signs and developmental milestones are normal. The diaper area and mucosal regions are unaffected.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 2-year-old boy with a recurrent rash on the cheeks, trunk, and arms. He has had a few upper respiratory infections but is otherwise healthy.

trec-202219.raw: A 7-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department by her parents for generalized rash.  The mother reports that she was playing outside wearing a skirt and felt a sharp pain in her arm while seating on a mat, plying with her doll.  Her mother suspects that something had stung her.   The patient's blood pressure is 75/55 mm Hg and her heart rate is 122/min.  Physical examination shows erythematous, raised plaques over the trunk, extremities, and face.  Lung auscultation reveals bilateral expiratory wheezes.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 7-year-old girl presents with a generalized rash, hypotension, tachycardia, erythematous raised plaques, and bilateral expiratory wheezes following a suspected sting while playing outside.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The patient is a 7-year-old girl with a generalized rash, low blood pressure, tachycardia, and wheezing.

trec-202220.raw: A 49-year-old man comes to the office because of the bulging in his groin.  Physical examination shows a swelling above the inguinal ligament. He does not smoke, but drinks alcohol occasionally. His vital signs and other physical examinations are unremarkable. He is referred to a surgeon and scheduled to undergo elective laparoscopic hernia repair.

trec-202222.raw:
A 15-year-old boy with mild intellectual disability is brought to the office by his parents for a routine physical examination.  The boy is going to a school for students with learning disabilities.  The patient was adopted, and his immunizations are up to date.  Review of the patient's medical records is notable for cytogenetic studies that showed a small gap near the tip of the long arm of the X chromosome, which is consistent with fragile X syndrome, an X-linked disorder. The defect is an unstable expansion of trinucleotide repeats (CGG) in the fragile X mental retardation 1 (FMR1) gene, located on the long arm of the X chromosome. He is not using any medications and vital signs are within normal levels. His blood chemistry analysis as bellow:
Blood Chemistry Value      Normal Range     Patient Value
Glucose                    90-120 mg/dl     95 mg/dl
BUN (Blood Urea Nitrogen)  7-24 mg/dl       10 mg/dl
Creatinine                 0.7-1.4 mg/dl    0.8 mg/dl
Calcium                    8.5-10.5 mg/dl   9 mg/dl
Sodium                     134-143 mEq/L    135 mEq/L
Potassium                  3.5-4.5 mEq/L    3.7 mEq/L
Chloride                   95-108 mEq/L     98 mEq/L
CO2                        20-30 mEq/L      25 mEq/L
Blood pH                   7.38-7.42        7. 39

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 15-year-old boy with mild intellectual disability, attending a school for students with learning disabilities, has been diagnosed with fragile X syndrome, an X-linked disorder due to an unstable expansion of trinucleotide repeats (CGG) in the FMR1 gene. His immunizations are up to date, and he is not on any medications. His vital signs and blood chemistry values are within normal ranges.

gpt-35-turbo.summary: The main medical problems of the patient include mild intellectual disability and fragile X syndrome.
conditions: School for students with learning disabilities
Small gap near the tip of the long arm of the X chromosome
Long arm of the X chromosome

trec-202237.raw: A 47-year-old man comes to the office due to weight gain and fatigue.  He is not able to lift heavy objects or climb stairs. Family history is positive for DM type 2 and HTN in his father.  Blood pressure is 165/90 mm Hg and pulse is 85/min.  On physical examination, there is symmetric proximal muscle weakness of the upper and lower extremities.  Fasting plasma glucose level is 138 mg/dL and 24-hour urinary cortisol is twice the upper normal limit.  Further evaluation reveals that high-dose, but not low-dose, dexamethasone suppresses serum cortisol levels.  Serum ACTH levels are high-normal. This patient's findings are consistent with endogenous Cushing Syndrome.

Further tests show that high-dose dexamethasone suppresses serum cortisol levels, and serum ACTH levels are high-normal, indicating endogenous Cushing Syndrome.
